runs.comm: full and wide down the leg side, McCullum looks to flick but the ball clips the pads and escapes for four leg byes
a good length outside off stump, McCullum pushes into the covers and calls for the run, the throw comes in quick and hits the stumps, but Fleming's safely home
good ball, full and swinging in from outside off stump, Fleming stands leaden-footed and pushes at it, and gets beaten
good length outside off stump, swings in and Fleming works that into the square leg region for one
fullish length, McCullum comes down the track to greet the ball, but can only smash that to cover
slammed! Full outside off stump, asking for trouble, McCullum sees it early and just frees the arms, smashing it high and hard over extra cover for maximum! First six of the innings!
hello and welcome, says Fleming! Full and wide outside off stump, and he just slams that ever so sweetly through the covers, full swing of the arms and thumped for four
four more! Not as full but still very wide, and Fleming has another swing at that, but gets a thick outside edge that flies in the vacant slip region for four

oh ho, another! Maharoof moves around the wicket, and still pitches wide of off stump, and again Fleming  just swings the bat and it and gets a regulation thick edge that screams into that gap at slip and races away for four
a good length outside off stump, Fleming stands and opens the face of the bat to run it down to third man for one
a good length and moving down leg stump, and McCullum times that nicely off the hips, finds the gap behind square, and picks up four more
quicker ball, fullish but going down leg stump, McCullum tries to work it fine but misses, gets rapped on the pads, Maharoof yells in vain but that was clearly going down
a good length on off stump, he looks to smash across the line but cant beat the fielders on the on side
a tad fuller, again he looks to swipe across the line, but ends up getting a single towards mid-off
good length angled across him, he tries to dab that down to third man but cant beat gully
full on middle and leg, driven to mid-on for one

dropped! Fullish outside off stump, Fleming swings it across the line, doesnt time it well, the ball bobs up over mid-on where Jayasuriya runs back and dives behind him, the ball swirling overhead, and he gets his right hand to it but cant hold on, a very tough chance goes down
full on leg stump, flicked right to short fine leg
full outside off stump, the rank half-volley, and McCullum clears the front leg and smokes that nicely over mid-off for four, shot!
full outside off stump again, and this time he swings across the line and ends up mistiming that to midwicket
easy as they come! A full toss on leg stump, and Fleming dispatches that over square leg for four, runs coming hard and fast here!
slower ball, rolls his fingers over it and doesnt pitch it full outside off stump, Fleming is beaten by the slowness and swings wildly and gets beaten
fullish on leg stump, Fleming flicks into square leg and calls for the run, McCullum is in his happy zone and doesnt respond well, theres a mix-up but they get the run, just

he's not dealing in singles! Full toss on middle and leg, and McCullum swivels into his pull shot, not timed well but theres enough power on it to help it along its away over backward square leg for six
fullish, he drives and gets an inside edge to short fine leg
full and slow outside off stump, he backs away and tries the dab, but gets beaten
fullish on middle and leg, driven down to long-on, Fleming wants two and gets it in the end
speared into leg stump, Fleming falls forward but times it well enough into midwicket for two more
again its too full on the legs, and Fleming chips that into the gap at midwicket for another couple, easy going
shot! Full outside off stump, and he eases into a nice drive past mid-off for four
full outside off stump, inside edges the attempted slog into midwicket

superb! Short and wide outside off stump, and its slammed, hard and flat, smack over point for four, Murali at point tried to go for the catch and almost cops one hard on the finger as he tried to get the hand out of the way at the last minute
short of a good length on middle and off, Fleming swings that one-handed over square leg for one
slower and full, the attempted yorker, well bowled, and McCullum does well to dig it out back to Fernando
well bowled! Quick on a good length, angled into the ribs from off stump, and McCullum is cramped for room and ends up defending into the on side
fullish outside off stump, driven out towards mid-off, just a single
Wow! Tossed up outside off stump, and McCullum plants the foot forward and slams that high over long-on for six, welcome Murali!
carnage! A full toss on middle and leg, and McCullum just swings that high over backward square leg for six more
flat outside off stump, McCullum comes forward and uses the soft hands to push it into the covers for one
flat outside off stump, Fleming comes forward and uses the soft hands to push it into the covers for one

bowled 'em! Slower ball on a good length on middle and off, Fleming doesnt expect it to come on that slowly, swings across the line and gets beaten all ends up and his furniture is disturbed! Maharoof gets the crucial breakthrough, but what a start from New Zealand
good ball, full outside off stump and swinging in, Franklin gets half-forward and pokes at it, and gets beaten
back of a good length outside off stump, Franklin comes forward and pushes, getting a thick edge down to Vaas at third man
slower and fullish on leg stump, McCullum works it to square leg for one
good stuff! Slower and fuller outside off stump, Franklin swings across the line and gets beaten comprehensively, a very good over from Maharoof

and he's gone! Tossed up outside off stump, McCullum sweeps from where it landed and can only slog it out to Tharanga at deep midwicket, who pouches a simple catch into his lap, Murali gets his revenge
tossed up outside leg stump, Franklin sweeps to backward square leg
quicker and flatter outside off stump, Taylor cant adjust well enough and ends up dropping the hands, and the ball runs past Sangakkara
tossed up on middle and leg, he sweeps but cant time it at all
again he tosses it up on middle and leg, and this time he times the sweep well enough and picks up four through square leg
full outside off stump, driven down to long-off for one
a good length outside off stump, Franklin drops the hands but cant beat point
fullish on middle and leg, Franklin hits through the line and beats mid-on for four
shot! A good length outside off stump, and Franklin just picks it high over long-off for six, timed sweetly off the middle of the bat, excellent shot
short outside off stump, dabbed to backward point for one
short delivery outside leg, Franklin goes down the legside and tries to pul it, misses teh line and almost drags it back ontoi his stumps
another legside delivery, worked away to the legside for a single
pitches on middle ad straightens, the batsman tries to sweep it, misses and is rapped on the pad, there's a huge appeal from Murali, but the umpire is not interested
comes off the pad and rolls away to the leg side
swept away backward of square for one, doesn't get it off the middle of the bat, but its still runs
wide delivery down the legside, its a straighter one too, Sangakara does well to get a hand to it, but its still to wide and the batsmen cross over for another extra
tossed up delivery, the attempted sweep shot, comes off the inside edge and rolls away to fine leg, the fielder inspite of being inside the 30-yard circle cant save the single though
flat delivery outside the leg stump, driven back past the bowler to mid-on, Jayasuriya rus across and fields it

there's the wicket, well almost!! Jayasuriya throws this one up just a tad, the batsman attempts a sweep shot ad misses the ball completely, looks like he loses balance in teh process and Sangakkara is quick to whip off the bails, its referred to the TV Umpire, but the foots back in time
single to mid wicket
and now there's the wicket!!! its a flat delivery, fired in, Franklin tries his hand at the reverse sweep, misses the ball and is rapped in front - LBWs dont come any easier for the umpires!
fuller delivery outside leg, almost yorker length and its worked away to fine leg for a single - gets off the mark immediately
tossed up this time, the batsman goes for the heave, but misses the ball completely and it comes off his body.
starts off with a regulation good length delivery thats tapped to extra cover for one
fuller length delivery, its guided wide of the man at point, and they scamper through for two - Vaas the fielder there - should have been down to one run there
fuller length and it gets the treatment it deserves, its creamed away through the vacant spaces in the cover region and the ball races away - classy shot that one
its short this time, and this one gets punished rightly, pulled away to the mid wicket fence
nearly a yorker length delivery at 144kmph, its driven away to long on for a brace, took a chance on Atapattu's weak arm then
fuller length again, right up at the batsman's foot, its dug out rightly and they take a single before the mid-on fielder can clean it up
single taken backward of square
again driven to long on and they scamper through for two, Fernando fires in a throw to no-man's land, that's an opportunity for an extra run - two becomes three
again driven to Fernando at long on for one
tossed up delivery, its worked away to mid wicket - the batsmen cross through for a single before Jayawardene can field and return the ball back to the bowler
Murali back, its swept away from in front of the stumps to fine leg, comes off the inside edge of the bat this time

slog sweep this time, misses the ball and is rapped on the pads, huge appeal from Murali, but Sangakkara was clearly down the leg side and that was a good indication to the umpire that it would have missed the leg stump

and again, but this time its out! goes for a slog sweep, misses the ball again, the difference this time is he is hit in front of the off stump, and the umpire reckons it would have crashed into ths stumps. That's out!
tossed up delivery, the batsman comes forward and defends, thinks off a single, takes a start but decides against it
an appeal again, came forward to play a shot - was the bat hidden the pad - not sure, there's an appeal for LBW, but the impact was outside off, and they scamper through for a legbye
tossed up delivery outside off, driven to deep cover for one
tossed up delivery, makes room and tries to cut it, the ball comes off the inside edge
fired down the leg side, Marshall goes for a sweep but doesnt make contact, that was a hit-me kind of a delivery
cut away to deep cover for one

and thats another wicket. tossed up delivery, its driven off the backfoot, comes off the inner half, its spooned up in the air at mid wicket, Chamara Silva times his jump to perfection, can't get it the first time, but grabs it on the second attempt. That's another NZ batsman walking back
starts off with a short delivery, and its pulled away to deep squareleg for one, thats good work by Kapugedera there
reverse swept to thirdman for one, and that's McGlashan's first run in international cricket
goes for a heave, across the line, but mises the line completely, and the ball goes through to the wicketkeeper betwee the bat and the stumps
slower delivery, and that's a single taken to cover - off the last ball of the over
tossed up again, and McGlashan tries his hand at the sweep shot, doesn't time it well - all he gets is a single for that much effort
Astle gets max for this one!! its flat this time, and Astle picks the length and the pace, and pulls it away - it was six from the moment it left the bat - good shot then

and now Jayasuriya gets his revenge, its fired in on leg stump and Astle tries the same shot as the previous ball, misses the line and the ball crashes into leg stump - sound of timber as they say, and Astle's short innings comes to an end
Chamara Silva in to the attack now, bowling his leg breaks, its pushed away into the open spaces on the onside for one
tossed up and its cut away to deep point for one, Vaas the man there
short delivery then, goes back to cut it but the ball comes off the bottom edge and Silva fields on his follow through, good work there by the bowler
driven uppishly past the diving bowler for one, spectacular dive by Silva then, but the ball was nowhere close to him

cross batted heave again, McGlashan misses the ball and loses balance, steps out and is found wanting by some quick glovework from Sangakkara who gathers the ball neatly and whips off the bails - no need to refer it to the TV Umpire there, its out!
its a low full toss and its chipped away uppishly to long on, Fernando runs across and pulls it back just in front of the boundary - enough time for two runs there
fuller length again, worked away to the mid wicket region for a single
swishes outside the off stump and misses, neatly gathered by Sangakkara who is standing upto the stumps

you miss I hit! change in pace from Vaas, rolls his fingers over the ball, bowls it full and straight, Bond tries to make room and hit it to the offside, misses it and the ball hits the base of the middle stump

full length delivery on the stumps, Mark Gillespie gets his foot outisde the off stump and kind of paddle sweeps to the leg side, its hit in the air but there's no man there and there's enough time for a couple
last delivery, and its guided to deep point for one
